intro: Dianthera elongata, commonly known as the elongated dianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dianthera elongata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
